page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: Lingfield has many varied types of dwellings some dating back as early as 1375 to the first property in the village. Although there were early scattered settlements it was the coming of the railway in 1880 when they were joined together. Many geographical factors dominate the early appearance of houses in the village.Nowadays the dwellings vary from large mansions to small farm cottages. Most roads are made up of a mixture of more than one type of house. Many roads have both new and old houses. Of the dwellings in the area about 1/3 are detached, just over 1/3 _semi detached, of the remainder, just over 1/2 are bungalows. The rest are flats and terraced houses. Most bungalows are in the Fecourt area. About three quarters of residents
